ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Again, no indeed! They will soon know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will indeed come to know soon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: again, no indeed; soon will they come to know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Yes, indeed, before long they will learn all about it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Again surely yes, they will soon come to know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay, again, they will come to know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! Nay! they shall soon know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Again, no indeed; they shall soon know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, again, but they will come to know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Surely, they will soon find out the truth!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Again, by no means! anon they shall know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! Soon they will know for once again!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily, verily they shall soon (come to) know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, again, they will come to know!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Most certainly, they will find out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then, no! They are going to know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [78:5] Again, no indeed! They will come to know! ([reiterated] for emphasis; thumma is added here to declare that the second threat of chastisement is more severe than the first). God, exalted be He, then alludes to His power to resurrect, saying:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay) truly, (again, but they will come to know!) They will come to know in the grave what will be done with them. This is a threat from Allah to those who disbelieved in Muhammad (pbuh) and in the Qur'an. 722
